projects.title: Learning Theories Concept Map
projects.description: 'How do we learn?' Learning theories describe how
projects.goals_text: Learning the language of educators was an important reason for my interest in the MET program. In order to make connections between technology, students, and instructors it is important to have a good understanding of the context of the three.
projects.reflection: Learning the language of educators was an important reason for my interest in the MET program. In order to make connections between technology, students, and instructors it is important to have a good understanding of the context of the three.

projects.title: Neuroscience and Learning Introductory Course
projects.description: This introductory course was developed to introduce our peers to the neuroscience of learning. My background is in psychology, so the development of the content and the course itself was also an opportunity to review some of these concepts myself, but to think about them from the perspective of course design, or in relation to other learning theories.

projects.title: Rationales for eLearning
projects.description: Educational technology can be adopted at multiple levels: in a classroom, a program, or an entire institution. This evaluation guaged institutional preparedness eLearning by examining institutional culture, preparedness, and infrastructure.
projects.goals_text: how does this relate to my goals

projects.title: Design Thinking Workshop
projects.description: In this paper and accompanying workshop, I propose that Design Thinking is an appropriate model to connect Constructivist theory with practical application. The workshop proposed that participants use an adapted Design Thinking process to plan a constructivist lesson.
projects.goals_text: how does this relate to my goals

projects.title: A Course Companion Website
projects.description: In ETEC 524 course we developed the structure of a course, as well as the structure of a module of that course. I used Moodle as my course shell, but determined it was important to have content that 'lived on' past the end of a course. So, I developed the majority of my content in this course companion website.
projects.goals_text: how does this relate to my goals

projects.title: This ePortfolio
projects.description: Throughout the MET program, I have most enjoyed being able to build tools. This ePortfolio is no exception, and the biggest challenge. This ePortfolio dynamically creates its content, including what you are reading now.
